Address.Line: Room 502 Jack E. Brown building 3122 TAMU

Platform.Title: [Ecoli_ASv2] Affymetrix E. coli Antisense Genome Array
Platform.Description:
Affymetrix submissions are typically submitted to GEO using the GEOarchive method described at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/geo/info/geo_affy.html
Has 7312 entries and was indexed 20-May-2002. The GeneChip E. coli Antisense Genome Array can be used for examining expression of all known E. coli genes and discovering novel, uncharacterized intergenic transcripts. The array contains probe sets to detect the antisense strand of more than 4,200 known open reading frames. In addition, over 1,350 intergenic sequences can be interrogated in both directions permitting functional characterization of potentially important shorter expressed sequences. Sequence information for probes on the array correspond to the M49 version of the E. coli Genome Project database at the University of Wisconsin.
Keywords = high density oligonucleotide array

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: Affymetrix Probe Set ID

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Locus tag

Column.Name: Species Scientific Name
Column.Description: The genus and species of the organism represented by the probe set.

Column.Name: Annotation Date
Column.Description: The date that the annotations for this probe array were last updated. It will generally be earlier than the date when the annotations were posted on the Affymetrix web site.

Column.Name: Sequence Type
Column.Description: Indicates whether the sequence is an Exemplar, Consensus or Control sequence. An Exemplar is a single nucleotide sequence taken directly from a public database. This sequence could be an mRNA or EST. A Consensus sequence, is a nucleotide sequence assembled by Affymetrix, based on one or more sequence taken from a public database.

Column.Name: Representative Public ID
Column.Description: The accession number of a representative sequence. Note that for consensus-based probe sets, the representative sequence is only one of several sequences (sequence sub-clusters) used to build the consensus sequence and it is not directly used to derive the probe sequences. The representative sequence is chosen during array design as a sequence that is best associated with the transcribed region being interrogated by the probe set. Refer to the "Sequence Source" field to determine the database used.

Column.Name: Sequence Source
Column.Description: The database from which the sequence used to design this probe set was taken.

Column.Name: Target Description
Column.Description: GenBank description associated with the representative public identifier. Blank for some probe sets.

Column.Name: Gene Title
Column.Description: Title of Gene represented by the probe set.

Column.Name: Gene Symbol
Column.Description: A gene symbol, when one is available (from UniGene).

Column.Name: ENTREZ_GENE_ID
Column.Description: Entrez Gene Database UID

Column.Name: RefSeq Transcript ID
Column.Description: References to multiple sequences in RefSeq. The field contains the ID and Description for each entry, and there can be multiple entries per ProbeSet.

Column.Name: Gene Ontology Biological Process
Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Biological Process derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Column.Name: Gene Ontology Cellular Component
Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Cellular Component derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Column.Name: Gene Ontology Molecular Function
Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Molecular Function derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Sample.Title: BW25113 w/t LB glu 15hr biofilm cells

Channel.Characteristics: RNA extracted from biofilm cells of E. coli K12 wild type after 15 hours of growth in LB glu with glass wool
Channel.Label: biotin

Sample.Description: RNA extracted from biofilm cells of E. coli K12 wild type after 15 hours of growth in LB glu with glass wool

Column.Name: (BW25113LBglu15hbiofilm) Stat Pairs
Column.Description: Number of perfect match probes for the probeset

Column.Name: (BW25113LBglu15hbiofilm) Stat Pairs Used
Column.Description: Number of the mismatch probes for the probeset

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Signal intensity accepted from the probeset

Column.Name: ABS_CALL
Column.Description: Probeset signal: absent or present

Column.Name: DETECTION P-VALUE
Column.Description: Probeset signal: p-value (shows the coherency of the results)

Series.Title: E. coli K-12 mutant ycfR biofilm vs wild type 15 hr LB glu biofilm cells
Series.Summary: E. coli K-12 BW25113 mutant strain ycfR expression in biofilm cells relative to E. coli wild-type strain expression in biofilm cells. All samples cultured in LB glu with glass wool Keywords: Cell type comparison
Series.Overall-Design: Strains: E. coli K-12 BW25113 wild type and mutant ycfR Medium: LB glu Biofilm grown on glass wool Time: 15 hr Cell type: biofilm
